purpleculture_pinyin:
chāo
money; paper money; variant of 抄
Деньги; бумажные деньги; вариант 抄
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 钞)
Pictophonetic: 少 indicates the sound; 釒 (money) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 鈔票 [ chāo piào ]: paper money; a bill (e.g. 100 yuan); Classifiers: 张
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 少 [ shǎo ] few, little; less; inadequate
heisig_chinese_memo: Many people have paper money but few have a lot of gold.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Metal money is a common thing in coin form, but few (maybe no) countries have metal bills (paper money).
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold " to " less " sound. The original meaning is cross-take. "Shuowen": "Come, take money with a fork. From gold, less sound." Duan Yucai's note: "For those with a fork, the fingers are in contact with each other. When the fingers pierce into the person and take it freely, it is called money. The word is from gold. , Rong is pierced with gold and iron tools." The extension means plunder. "Dialect": "Chao is strong." Guo Pu's note: "Strength to take things." Such as "Han Shu. "Wang Mang Biography": "It's Sui, Red Eyebrow Lizidu, Fan Chong and others met with starvation. They started in Langxie, turned money and plundered, and the crowd was tens of thousands." "Saving the Side": "The betrayal of the Qiang captives from the past began from Liang and the merger, and extended to Si Li, the eastern disaster Zhao, Wei, the western currency of Shu and Han, the five states are broken, the six prefectures are cut off, the Zhou travels thousands of miles, and the wild has no relics. ."

" Banknotes " also mean transcription and transcription. Such as "Baopuzi. "Golden Pill": "The capital of the gold pill is compared with the old banknotes, so as to show that the comrades are better." Song Dynasty Lu You "Reading in the Cold Night": "Wei Bian repeatedly wears iron inkstones and recites hand notes for years." The selected works are also called " banknotes ." Such as Yu Shinan's "Beitang Book Notes", Pan Yonggu's "Song Barnyard Notes" and Xu Ke's "Qing Barnyard Notes".

In the Song Dynasty, the production and sales of tea and salt were controlled by the government. Merchants who are allowed to transport and sell these goods need to obtain a certificate issued by the government, called "Chao Yin". "Song History. Shihuo Zhi 2 3": "In the first year of Emperor Gaozong’s Shaoxing, there was a secretary for Wuzhou to station troops, so he asked the pile to share the money, but the road was not accessible, and the money was too heavy. Ask for money for goods, and I would like to get tea, salt, and fragrant banknotes." Later, " banknotes " are used to denote banknotes, such as the "handed notes" issued by gold and yuan, and the "bao notes" issued by Ming and Qing. "History of Ming Dynasty. Shihuo Zhi 5: "Banknotes began with the flying money of the Tang Dynasty, the meeting of the Song Dynasty, and the handing of money by the Jinzhi. The Yuan Dynasty always used the currency, and the money was a waste."

" Chao " means plundering righteousness, and when copying righteousness, it can be used for copying . Modern Chinese " money " represents a major bank notes, and transcription Yoshinori multi-use " copy ." See " copy ".

" Chao " is commonly used as " sing ", which means far-reaching. Zhu Junsheng "Shuowen Tongxun Zisheng": "Come, 叚borrowed as 眇." Such as "Guan Zi. "Youguan": "You can hear the extreme by listening to the notes, and you can see the unformed if you look at the new ones." Yin Zhizhang's note: "The notes are profound."
humanum_short_description_en: From " gold " to " less " sound. The original meaning is forking, and the extension means plundering.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「少」聲。本義是叉取。《說文》：「鈔，叉取也。从金，少聲。」段玉裁注：「叉者，手指相逪也。手指突入其閒而取之，是之謂鈔。字从金者，容以金鐵諸器刺取之矣。」引申表示掠奪。《方言》：「鈔，強也。」郭璞注：「強取物也。」如《漢書．王莽傳下》：「是歲，赤眉力子都、樊崇等以饑饉相聚，起於琅邪，轉鈔掠，眾皆萬數。」《潛夫論．救邊》：「往者羌虜背叛，始自涼、并，延及司隸，東禍趙、魏，西鈔蜀、漢，五州殘破，六郡削迹，周迴千里，野無孑遺。」

　　「鈔」也表示謄寫、抄錄。如《抱樸子．金丹》：「余今略鈔金丹之都較，以示後之同志好之者。」宋代陸游〈寒夜讀書〉：「韋編屢絕鐵硯穿，口誦手鈔那計年。」選錄抄寫而成的書作也稱為「鈔」。如虞世南《北堂書鈔》、潘永固《宋稗類鈔》和徐珂《清稗類鈔》。

　　宋代時，茶、鹽等的生產銷售皆由政府掌控。獲准運銷這些貨物的商人需領有政府發出的憑證，稱為「鈔引」。《宋史．食貨志下三》：「高宗紹興元年，有司因婺州屯兵，請樁辦合用錢，而路不通舟，錢重難致。乃造關子付婺州，召商人入中，執關於榷貨務請錢，願得茶、鹽、香貨鈔引者聽。」後以「鈔」表示鈔票，例如金、元發行的「交鈔」，明、清發行的「寶鈔」等。《明史．食貨志五》：「鈔始於唐之飛錢，宋之交會，金之交鈔。元世始終用鈔，錢幾廢矣。」

　　「鈔」表示掠奪義、抄寫義時又可作「抄」。現代漢語的「鈔」主要表示鈔票，而抄寫義則多用「抄」。參見「抄」。

　　「鈔」通作「眇」，表示深遠。朱駿聲《說文通訓字聲》：「鈔，叚借為眇。」如《管子．幼官》：「聽於鈔故能聞未極，視於新故能見未形。」尹知章注：「鈔，深遠也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「少」聲。本義是叉取，引申表示掠奪。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
鈔 (Simplified: 钞)
Pinyin: chāo
English Definition: money; paper money; variant of 抄
Total strokes: 12; Radical: 金
Pictophonetic: 少 indicates the sound; 釒 (money) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 少 [ shǎo ] few, little; less; inadequate
Example Words:
鈔票 [ chāo piào ]: paper money; a bill (e.g. 100 yuan); Classifiers: 张

(Simplified: 钞)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 少 indicates the sound; 釒 (money) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 6
Chinese: Many people have paper money but few have a lot of gold.
Meaning: paper money
Hanzi: 钞
Story: Metal money is a common thing in coin form, but few (maybe no) countries have metal bills (paper money).
Kind: traditional

從「 金 」，「 少 」聲。本義是叉取。《說文》：「鈔，叉取也。从金，少聲。」段玉裁注：「叉者，手指相逪也。手指突入其閒而取之，是之謂鈔。字从金者，容以金鐵諸器刺取之矣。」引申表示掠奪。《方言》：「鈔，強也。」郭璞注：「強取物也。」如《漢書．王莽傳下》：「是歲，赤眉力子都、樊崇等以饑饉相聚，起於琅邪，轉鈔掠，眾皆萬數。」《潛夫論．救邊》：「往者羌虜背叛，始自涼、并，延及司隸，東禍趙、魏，西鈔蜀、漢，五州殘破，六郡削迹，周迴千里，野無孑遺。」 「 鈔 」也表示謄寫、抄錄。如《抱樸子．金丹》：「余今略鈔金丹之都較，以示後之同志好之者。」宋代陸游〈寒夜讀書〉：「韋編屢絕鐵硯穿，口誦手鈔那計年。」選錄抄寫而成的書作也稱為「 鈔 」。如虞世南《北堂書鈔》、潘永固《宋稗類鈔》和徐珂《清稗類鈔》。 宋代時，茶、鹽等的生產銷售皆由政府掌控。獲准運銷這些貨物的商人需領有政府發出的憑證，稱為「鈔引」。《宋史．食貨志下三》：「高宗紹興元年，有司因婺州屯兵，請樁辦合用錢，而路不通舟，錢重難致。乃造關子付婺州，召商人入中，執關於榷貨務請錢，願得茶、鹽、香貨鈔引者聽。」後以「 鈔 」表示鈔票，例如金、元發行的「交鈔」，明、清發行的「寶鈔」等。《明史．食貨志五》：「鈔始於唐之飛錢，宋之交會，金之交鈔。元世始終用鈔，錢幾廢矣。」 「 鈔 」表示掠奪義、抄寫義時又可作「 抄 」。現代漢語的「 鈔 」主要表示鈔票，而抄寫義則多用「 抄 」。參見「 抄 」。 「 鈔 」通作「 眇 」，表示深遠。朱駿聲《說文通訓字聲》：「鈔，叚借為眇。」如《管子．幼官》：「聽於鈔故能聞未極，視於新故能見未形。」尹知章注：「鈔，深遠也。」

Seal characters (1)

鈔字的基本解释

鈔
chāo
见“钞”。

鈔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chāo］
［《廣韻》楚交切，平肴，初。］
［《廣韻》初教切，去效，初。］
“钞1”的繁体字。
(1)抢掠；强取。后作“抄”。
(2)誊写。也作“抄”。
(3)经过选录而成的集子。也作“抄”。
(4)佛教称诠释佛经经义的一种方法。疏解经，钞则解疏。
(5)同“抄”。古容量单位。一升的千分之一。亦泛指微量。参见“鈔撮”。
(6)纸币名。
(7)泛指钱。
(8)古时官府征收钱物后所给的单据。
(9)取近路行走。也作“抄”。
(10)通“眇”。微眇；仔细。
(11)姓。明有钞氏。见清黄宗羲《酉山许先生墓志铭》。

鈔字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鈔； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1298第22
【唐韻】【韻會】【正韻】楚交切【集韻】初交切，?音䜈。【說文】叉取也。【徐鉉曰】今俗別作抄。【廣韻】略也。【後漢·公孫瓚傳】尅會期日，攻鈔郡縣。　又【韻會】或作摷。【張衡·東京賦】摷昆聊。　又作抄。【杜甫詩】飯抄雲子白。　又姓。【正字通】明鈔秀，鈔奇。　又【增韻】謄寫也。【抱朴子·金丹卷】余令略鈔金丹之都，較以示後之同志者。　又【博雅】强也。　又【廣韻】初敎切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】楚敎切，?音勦。【周禮·夏官·射鳥氏敺烏鳶註】烏鳶善鈔，盜便汙人。【釋文】鈔，初敎反。　又【正字通】楮貨名。宋史，紹興二十四年，女眞以銅少，循宋交子法，造鈔引一貫、二貫、三貫、五貫、十貫五等謂之大鈔。一百、二百、三百、五百、七百五等謂之小鈔。與錢?用，以七年爲限，納舊易新，諸路置交鈔庫官受之，每貫取工墨錢十五文，公私便焉。　又【韻會定正】官收物而給印信文憑也。卽今鈔關。　又與杪同。【管子·幼官篇】敎行於鈔。【註】鈔，末也。【又】聽於鈔，故能聞未極。【註】鈔，深遠也。

鈔字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鈔字的起名意思

暂无。

Banknotes
Basic explanation of words
Banknotes
chāo
See "Banknotes".
Banknotes
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [chāo]
["Guangyun" Chu crosses, flat dishes, early. ]
["Guangyun" teaches cutting at the beginning, to effect, at the beginning. ]
The traditional characters of "CHAO 1 ".
(1) Looting; taking forcibly. Later "copy".
(2) Transcription. Also "copy".
(3) Collected by selection. Also "copy".
(4) Buddhism is called a method of interpreting the meaning of Buddhist scriptures. Relieve the scriptures, and the notes are the relief.
(5) Same as "copy". Ancient capacity unit. One thousandth of a liter. Also refers to trace amounts in general. See "Banknote Collection".
(6) The name of the banknote.
(7) Generally refers to money.
(8) In ancient times, the documents issued by the government after the collection of money and goods.
(9) Take a shortcut to walk. Also "copy".
(10) Through "sing". Slightly; carefully.
(11) Last name. Ming has Chao's. See the epitaph of Mr. Youshan Xu by Huang Zongxi in the Qing Dynasty.

In the history of the Song Dynasty, in the twenty-fourth year of Shaoxing, the female prince used copper less, and followed the Song Jiaozi method to make banknotes that are called Yiguan, Erguan, Sanguan, Wuguan, and Shiguanwu. One hundred, two hundred, three hundred, five hundred, seven hundred and five are called small notes. The use of money is limited to seven years, and the old is easy to be replaced. The banknotes will be accepted by all the way, and every fifteen pens of labor and ink will be taken, public and private.　[Yun Hui Dingzheng] The official received the goods and gave the certificate to the seal.卽jinchaoguan.　 Same as Ye.
